topic.title: HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade 2.0: Deploy the KVM Region Patches

body.p: The following patches addresses a number of issues in the KVM region.

Use the Horizon UI to see which patches have been deployed to the KVM region servers. Select the regionkvm, then click Admin, then System, and Inventory. Click Patches for a list of installed patches. Or use the CLI on the active KVM controller: sudo sw-patch query. Only deploy the patches in the following table that do not appear in the list.

ul.li: Corrects and issue where the coompute nodes do not get unlocked during patch update process.
Corrects an issue with PCI Bus Assignment for VM Guest.
Corrects an issue that prevented SSH connections to Board Management Controller;
Corrects an issue that caused VM migration problems while applying a patch to a live cloud;
Corrects an issue that caused controllers to automatically swacting;
Corrects an issue that caused compute nodes to degrade after applying the HP_15_Custom_PATCH_0002 patch;
Closes the Linux Grub backspace vulnerability.

li.p: Corrects an issue that prevented users from adding a second static route to data interface;
Corrects an issue that caused the AVS agent on the compute nodes to crash;
Corrects an issue that caused the networking agent on the compute nodes to not respond after launching a Heat stack;
Corrects an issue that caused a Horizon blocking page to occur when locking a host in booting state;
Corrects an issue that caused a Compute node to not run the patched RPMs, even though it shows patch-current

body.section:
Download the patches
If you have not downloaded the patch, launch the Helion Distribution Network (HDN). You must obtain a user account on HDN in order to download these files. In a browser, navigate to Helion Download Network(HDN).
Click Sign In to log in using your account.
After signing in, click the Downloads link in the menu on the left side of the page.
Download the required file and the associated checksum and signature files.
Verify the downloaded signature and the downloaded checksums.
Extract the compressed files until the TS_HP_15_Custom_PATCH_####.patch and readme files are available.

section.title: Install the patches

ol.li:
SSH into active controller in the KVM region.
For example: controller-0
Create a directory for the patch:mkdir -p /tmp/patches

Copy the following patch file to the /tmp/patches directory:
TS_HP_15_Custom_PATCH_0001_2.patch
TS_HP_15_Custom_PATCH_0002.patch
TS_HP_15_Custom_PATCH_0003.patch
TS_HP_15_Custom_PATCH_0004.patch

Execute the following command to registers all patches in the specific directory into an internal database: sudo sw-patch upload-dir /tmp/patches
Once registered, you can delete the patch files from the controller as the patches have been added to the database.

Execute the following commands to check if the patch is available for installation:sudo sw-patch query
For example:
Execute the following commands to check the current state of all the hosts:sudo sw-patch query-hostsYour host Reboot Required state will be Yes. For example:
Execute the following commands to apply the patch:sudo sw-patch apply --all source /etc/nova/openrc

Execute the following command to patch and reboot the standby controller: system host-patch-reboot <controller-#>
For example if controller-1 is the standby controller:system host-patch-reboot controller-1
Wait until the standby controller comes up after patching.

Execute the following command to switch the active controller from the specified controller: system host-swact controller-#
For example, if the active controller is controller-0:system host-swact controller-0
This command makes controller-1 the active controller and makes controller-0 the standby.

section.p: Log onto the newly active controller and patch the standby controller.

ol.li:
SSH into the newly active controller.
For example: controller-1.

Execute the following command to patch and reboot the standby controller: system host-patch-reboot <controller-#>
For example if controller-0 is the standby controller:system host-patch-reboot controller-0

section.p: From the active controller, perform the following steps:

ol.li: Execute the following command to patch and reboot the compute-0: system host-patch-reboot compute-0
Execute the following command to patch and reboot compute-1: system host-patch-reboot compute-1
Apply the patch to any remaining compute nodes. You can use the check sudo sw-patch query-hosts command to verify that the patch is applied on all the hosts.
